key_title: Key to the species of Tetratheca

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Tremandraceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Tremandraceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Stems virtually leafless; sepals to c. 1 mm long
Stems leafy at least on lower parts; sepals more than 1 mm long
Sepals persistent or tardily deciduous, with no joint at their junction with the receptacle; stem-hairs gland-tipped
Sepals readily deciduous, with a conspicuous junction with the receptacle; stem-hairs not gland-tipped
Peduncles with gland-tipped hairs (rarely almost absent in Tetratheca ciliata, and then upper part of sepals strongly reflexed) as well as shorter acicular hairs
Peduncles with few gland-tipped hairs usually less than 1 mm long; leaves usually present in flowering region; stems with hairs of various length
Peduncles with many gland-tipped hairs 1–2 mm long; leaves mainly confined to lower stems, reduced and scale-like in flowering region; stems scabrous or with minute straight hairs
Leaves alternate, opposite or in irregular whorls of 3 or 4; ovules usually 2, 1 per cell
Leaves in regular whorls of 3–6; ovules 4, 2 per cell
Plant erect or spreading; stems not much-branched basally; branches mostly longer than 20 cm; petals more than 5 mm long; peduncles 4–9 mm long in mature flower
Plant procumbent or weakly ascending; stems much-branched basally; branches mostly to c. 20 cm long; petals less than 5 mm long; peduncles under 4 mm long in mature flower

Stem-hairs mostly less than 0.5 mm long, curved or curled; peduncles hooked near apex, usually glabrous, rarely with a few erect hairs near apex; sepals less than 2.5 mm long, scarcely thickened near base

Stem-hairs mostly 0.5–1.5 mm long, mainly antrorse but many twisted and irregular; peduncles not hooked, usually sparsely or densely hairy, rarely glabrous; sepals more than 2.5 mm long, slightly thickened near base
